thread.title: US warns of hate speech as Myanmar prepares for elections
thread.title_full: US warns of hate speech as Myanmar prepares for elections - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Matthew Pennington, Associated Press
title: US warns of hate speech as Myanmar prepares for elections
text: Photo: Hkun Lat, AP Myanmar’s specially recruited police officers for election duties stand at attention as they start a training class in Mandalay, Myanmar, Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015. Myanmar temporally recruited 40,000 new officers for upcoming election duties schedule for November 8. Myanmar’s specially recruited police officers for election duties... WASHINGTON (AP) — The top U.S. diplomat for East Asia is warning that the politicization of religion and the spread of hate speech could lead to violence in Myanmar as it prepares for landmark Nov. 8 elections. Myanmar’s specially recruited police officers for election duties stand at attention as they start a training class in Mandalay, Myanmar, Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015. Myanmar temporally recruited 40,000 new officers for upcoming election duties schedule for November 8. Myanmar’s specially recruited police officers for election duties... WASHINGTON (AP) — The top U.S. diplomat for East Asia is warning that the politicization of religion and the spread of hate speech could lead to violence in Myanmar as it prepares for landmark Nov. 8 elections.
